blocks.label: The Absolute
blocks.english: Ein Sof Â· The Infinite Essence
blocks.tagline: "Kadmon l'chol HaKadmonim" â€” before all. Absolutely simple, infinite light. "I, Hashem, have not changed" â€” ×™×—×™×“: singularity in which creation does not register as a separate reality at all.

details.title: Nature
details.content: Absolutely simple (pashut b'tachlit). No distinction between "before" and "after" creation. From this perspective, the entire chain of worlds is "as nothing" (×›×œ× ×—×©×™×‘).

details.title: Tzimtzum
details.content: From absolute infinity no specific Sefirah could emerge â€” only infinite emanations in infinite forms. Tzimtzum creates the Chalal (empty space) for the Kav to enter and produce a measured chain of worlds.

details.title: Kol Yachol
details.content: The All-Capable One can do everything, including limiting Himself. Creating boundaries is an expression of infinite power, not a diminishment. "Amar l'olamo dai" â€” He said to His world: Enough!

details.title: Igul HaGadol
details.content: The pre-Tzimtzum encompassing light becomes the Levush Malchut after Tzimtzum â€” wrapping around the entire Parzuf Adam like a talit, sustaining all existence as Yesh from afar.

blocks.label: Concealment of All Concealments
blocks.english: Stimu d'Chol Stimmin Â· Reisha d'Lo Ityada
blocks.tagline: Concealed even from the hidden worlds. Root of ××¡×ª×¨ / Megillat Esther. "Astir Panai ba'yom ha'hu" â€” even in the future revelation this remains hidden. Source of Purim's concealed miracle â€” deeper than all open wonders.

details.title: Three Levels of Concealment
details.content: Almin d'Itgaliyan â€” revealed worlds Â· Almin Stimin â€” Atik/Arich, hidden worlds Â· Stimu d'Chol Stimmin â€” concealed even from the hidden worlds. Future revelation = level 2 unveiled. Purim touches level 3.

details.title: Why Purim Surpasses the Future
details.content: Open miracles come from hidden worlds being revealed. Purim's hidden miracle comes from above even the hidden worlds. Like the great torch: faint distant light proves a far larger source than any bright nearby candle.

details.title: The Galut Paradox
details.content: The hester panim of galut originates from a higher source than the revelations of the future. The deepest concealment = the highest origin. "Whoever is not in hester panim is not from them."

details.title: The Third Day

blocks.label: Crown of Divine Sovereignty
blocks.english: Keter d'Malchut d'Ein Sof Â· Oneg HaPashut Â· Simple Divine Delight
blocks.tagline: "Nachat ruach" that arises when a mitzvah is performed in deed. Source of the royal crown. Exclusive to Israel â€” root of Yechidah. Formed through × ×¢×©×” â€” bitul ratzon beyond all reason.

details.title: Na'aseh and the Crown
details.content: At Sinai, Na'aseh v'Nishma â€” "we will do" before "we will hear" â€” is bitul beyond reason, reaching Keter she'b'Keter. Two crowns were given: one for Na'aseh, one for Nishma = 620 pillars of light (×ª×¨×´×— ×¢××•×“×™ ××•×¨).

details.title: Why Israel Alone
details.content: The crown = sha'ashuei ha'Melech, the Essence's own inner delight. Haman's power reaches only the Makif d'Chayah (Chochmah level). Only Israel's Yechidah â€” rooted in the Essence â€” can form the crown through absolute bitul.

details.title: Crown â†’ Garment (not the reverse)
details.content: The Keter is the source of the Levush. The delight from "Na'aseh" motivates the entire system of Malchut. ×¡×•×£ ××¢×©×” ×¢×œ×” ×‘××—×©×‘×” ×ª×—×™×œ×” â€” the end of action arose first in the primordial thought.

details.title: Purim Completes Sinai
details.content: Sinai = techilat ha-kabbalah (beginning). Purim = gmar ha-kabbalah (completion). The Jews chose death over conversion â€” mesirut nefesh in actual deed, not merely in speech or intention. "V'kibel haYehudim."

blocks.label: Primordial Will
blocks.english: Malchut d'Ein Sof Â· Ratzon Kadum Â· "I Shall Reign"
blocks.tagline: The first glimmer toward creation â€” not the Essence itself, but its "last" dimension. "Re'uta d'Chol Re'utin" â€” every subsequent divine will is contained equally within this one primordial will.

details.title: Mashal: The King's Palace
details.content: The king's single decision to build contains every detail â€” foundation and plaster â€” equally. From the Ratzon Kadum, the highest Sefirah and the lowest mineral are equally present. Hierarchy only appears in the revealed will.

details.title: Mashal: The Merchant
details.content: The merchant's overall intent (to profit) contains every travel preparation as essentially as the main transaction. The Ratzon Kadum sustains every detail equally in concealment (he'elem) â€” what appears trivial in the revealed will is equally essential in the primordial.

details.title: It'aruta d'l'Tata
details.content: ×™×‘×™××• â€” "let them bring." Divine Kingship depends on arousal from below. "Who would He reign over?" The thought "Ana Emloch" arose because of the end-goal: a dwelling for the Infinite in the lower realms through physical mitzvot.

details.title: Source of the Kav
details.content: The Kav v'Chut (line of light after Tzimtzum) emerges from Malchut d'Ein Sof and creates Parzuf Adam â€” the human-form template of all the Sefirot. Above the entire Kav: the pre-Tzimtzum Igul HaGadol as Levush Malchut.

blocks.label: Encompassing Light
blocks.english: Sovev Kol Almin Â· Galgalta (Outer Keter) Â· Levush Malchut Â· Sus
blocks.tagline: Highest root â€” yet manifests most externally. Source of ×™×© ×××™×Ÿ at every level. Encompasses all four worlds equally â€” no hierarchy in Yesh-ness. Also corresponds to the ×¡×•×¡ (horse = 2Ã—S"AG = 126).

details.title: Yesh from Sovev â€” Universal Rule
details.content: Every entity's spiritual life-force flows through Memale. But the fact that it exists as a concrete Yesh â€” a "something" â€” comes from Sovev. Even Chochmah's identity as "Chochmah" (rather than formless light) comes from Sovev.

details.title: Ko'ach HaHiyuli
details.content: Like the soul's undifferentiated potential sustaining sight, hearing, and walking equally â€” Sovev sustains the Yesh of Chochmah and a blade of grass equally. No hierarchy in Yesh-ness from Sovev's perspective. This is the great equalizer.

details.title: Why More External = Higher Root
details.content: An Ein Sof light cannot be contained in pnimiyut â€” it would overwhelm everything. It can only manifest as an external garment. The exaltedness of the source is WHY it appears externally. Galgalta (outer Keter) is from a higher root than Mo'S (inner Keter).

details.title: The Sus â€” Horse of Letters
details.content: Sus (×¡×•×¡) = 2 Ã— 63 (S"AG). Two Samechs (×¡ â€” round, closed, concealed Peleh) linked by Vav: upper concealment â†’ lower concealment. Carries divine light from the spiritual realm all the way to physical gashmiyut â€” farther than any inner light can reach.

blocks.label: Hidden Wisdom
blocks.english: Mochah Stima'ah Â· Inner Keter Â· Source of All Inner Lights
blocks.tagline: The "Ayin" from which Chochmah emerges. Called "stima'ah" not because it hides intentionally â€” but because it cannot project far enough to reach the physical realm. A brilliant candle that illuminates its room but not the distant field.

details.title: Mo'S vs. Galgalta â€” The Paradox
details.content: Mo'S: brighter, more refined, illuminates pnimiyut â€” but lower root, cannot descend to the physical. Galgalta: more external, "lower" in appearance â€” but higher root, illuminates the most distant places through mitzvot in action.

details.title: The Engraved Gem
details.content: Letters engraved in a brilliant gem are invisible â€” the radiance overwhelms all contrast. Press it into wax: the letters appear clearly. Mo'S's brilliance conceals within its own domain. Only through the external vessel do the blueprints of creation become visible.

details.title: "Lo Mitpate'ach"
details.content: Chochmah of Atzilut opens to 32 paths. But Mo'S ×œ× ××ª×¤×ª×— ×œ×œ×´×‘ ×©×‘×™×œ×™×Ÿ â€” does not open to 32 paths. "The brain quiet and settled in its place" â€” not because it is superior, but because its power is insufficient to project outward and downward.

details.title: Razi d'Oraita vs. Halachot
details.content: Kabbalistic secrets come from Mo'S â€” brilliant "Or Tzach" (pure light). Yet even Or Tzach "is dark compared to Atik HaAtikin." The great torch (Galgalta/Halachot) appears dim â€” yet its source far exceeds the small candle (Mo'S/Kabbalah).

blocks.label: Beginning of the Chain
blocks.english: Chochmah Ila'ah Â· Shem M"AH (45) Â· Reshit HaGilui Â· Root of Torah
blocks.tagline: "V'haChochmah me'Ayin timatze" â€” found from Ayin (nothingness). First link in the chain of Hishtalshelut. ×›×— ××” â€” the power of nullification. Root of Torah. Moshe's soul-root. ××¨×“×›×™ = ××¨ ×“×§×™×.

details.title: Reshit â€” First Link
details.content: "Bereishit" â†’ ×‘×—×›××ª× (with wisdom). Chochmah is "reshit" because after it comes second and third â€” it belongs to Memale Kol Almin. The Ayin is its source above; Chochmah is the first point of revelation, not the Ayin itself.

details.title: Moshe's Heaviness of Mouth
details.content: Moshe's soul-root was in the Ayin itself â€” beyond all expression. Torah was given through him because he could access that source, but bringing it into speech (Written and Oral Torah) was a descent for his soul.

details.title: The Aleph of Adam
details.content: Shem M"AH (45 = ××“×) pervades all of Atzilut. The Aleph (×) = upper Yud (Chochmah above) + Vav (connector) + lower Yud (Chochmah below). Through this structure, opposites are united â€” right and left, Chesed and Gevurah.

details.title: Torah vs. Mitzvot Resolved
details.content: Torah originates in Chochmah â€” Memale, inner revelation. Mitzvot (physical objects) connect to Sovev â€” above Chochmah. Each has a unique advantage: Torah for inner depth; Mitzvot for connection to the Essence. Both are necessary and neither subsumes the other.

blocks.label: Chain of Worlds
blocks.english: Hishtalshelut Â· Memale Kol Almin Â· Atzilut â†’ Beriah â†’ Yetzirah â†’ Asiyah
blocks.tagline: Inner light descending level by level. Intellect births emotion; emotion clothes in thought; thought descends to speech and action. Metatron â€” the "small face" with contracted consciousness â€” carries light through 18,000 worlds at night.

details.title: 18 Brachot / Amidah
details.content: The 18 blessings correspond to the 18 vertebrae of the spine â€” the spinal cord extending from the brain. Bowing in "Baruch" = drawing brain-consciousness through each vertebra. Three times daily, drawing Sovev into Memale from Atzilut to Beriah.

details.title: Metatron â€” Night Horse
details.content: "The Holy One rides His swift Cherub through 18,000 worlds." Metatron = "measured/limited." Atzilut's 18 brachot Ã— 1,000 degrees = 18,000. The 2 missing Alephs = Chochmah and Binah (Keter) which cannot enter Metatron's contracted form.

details.title: Origin of Kelim (Vessels)
details.content: Orot (lights) come from the Kav â€” through Hishtalshelut. But Kelim â€” the power of each light to exist as a bounded "something" â€” come from Sovev (Makif HaKlali), not the Kav. Kelim from the chain would dissolve back into their source.

details.title: Mati v'Lo Mati
details.content: "Touching and not touching" â€” the dynamic of Makif relating to Pnimi. The vessel's "Shov" (drawing-down) comes before the light's "Ratzo" (ascent) â€” proving the vessel is from a higher source than the light it contains.

blocks.label: Physical World Â· Mitzvot in Action
blocks.english: Gashmiyut Â· Physical Mitzvot Â· The Farthest Point â€” From the Highest Source
blocks.tagline: Leather, wool, fruit, coins become portals to ×¡×•×‘×‘ ×›×œ ×¢×œ××™×Ÿ. 248 mitzvot = 248 limbs of the divine Adam. The most physical = proof of the highest source. ××”×¨! â€” Hasten the birurim!

details.title: Tzurah and Chomer
details.content: Every created being has: Tzurah (form/soul) from Memale â€” the Ten Utterances, specific letter-combinations. Chomer (substance/body) from Sovev â€” "Ki Hu tzivah." "Vayehi chen" â€” after the spiritual form, Sovev separately commands the physical substance into being.

details.title: Halachah = Ma'or Reaching Farthest
details.content: Halachot (tumah/taharah, kosher/treif) deal with the most physical matters â€” yet originate from the Ma'or (the Essence itself, not merely the Or). Even Kabbalistic secrets are "a candle" compared to the great torch of the Halachot's concealed inner light.

details.title: Amalek â€” Waves Without Substance
details.content: Ocean waves rise high â€” but water flows downward; wind alone lifts them. Amalek = pure gasut haruach without inner content. Not a middah (which can be transformed) but brazenness alone. The shilya (afterbirth) â€” discarded at birth. Amalek's "tikkun" IS its dissolution.

details.title: Maher â€” Hasten the Redemption
details.content: ×–×›×• â€” ××—×™×©× ×”, ×œ× ×–×›×• â€” ×‘×¢×™×ª×”. Every mitzvah extracts sparks from Nogah. When all 288 sparks are refined, kelipot collapse. Hastening the birur is cosmic compassion â€” giving even the forces of darkness a chance at rectification rather than annihilation.

blocks.text: The Three Royal Items â€” Megillat Esther 6:8

items.description: Royal Garment = Sovev / Galgalta. Pre-Tzimtzum encompassing light wrapping Parzuf Adam like a talit. Mitzvah objects before performance. Provided by Haman â€” holy hitnasut after birur.
items.detail: The Levush = divine ge'ut (exaltedness). Haman's root after birur is holy hitnasut â€” elevated heart in divine service ("b'nei banav shel Haman lamdu Torah b'rabbim"). He provides this garment because his root is the very quality of exaltedness that transcends reason. "Hashem Melech Ge'ut Lavesh."

items.description: Letter-vehicles (tzirufei otiyot). Sus (×¡×•×¡) = 2Ã—63 (S"AG). Two Samechs linked by Vav: upper concealment â†’ lower concealment. Carries light to physical gashmiyut. Also provided by Haman through birur of S"AG.
items.detail: The horse is stronger than the rider â€” S"AG (63) > M"AH (45). Samech = round, closed, the concealed Peleh. Haman's shattered S"AG (from Shevirat HaKelim) after birur becomes the holy vehicle carrying highest light to the farthest places. "Ki tirkav al susecha â€” yeshuah" = 370 lights of Arich illuminating Chochmah.

items.description: Royal Crown = Keter d'Malchut d'Ein Sof. Oneg HaPashut â€” formed only through actual mitzvah performance. Israel's exclusive domain (Yechidah). Cannot come through Haman.
items.detail: "B'Rosho" â€” the crown was placed on the horse's head: the refined letter-vehicles receive the crown. Sandalfon binds crowns for the King from the prayers of Israel. The letters of Nogah, refined through teshuvah from the depths of the heart, become the avanei ha'keter â€” crown-stones of Keter Malchut.

items.content: Sovev â€” encompasses all worlds equally; source of the Yesh (physical substance) of each thing Â· Memale â€” fills worlds from within through the chain of cause-and-effect, level by level
Or (light) â€” Torah, inner illumination, brilliant nearby Â· Ma'or (luminary) â€” the Essence itself, source of Halachot reaching the farthest place; faint yet from the greatest source
Levush â€” mitzvah object before performance; Sovev from afar Â· Keter â€” the actual performance of the mitzvah; divine delight (Oneg HaPashut); from a higher root still
Galgalta (outer Keter) â€” highest root, source of kelim, reaches farthest into the physical Â· Mo'S (inner Keter) â€” more refined and brighter internally, but cannot descend as far

Ratzo â€” ecstatic ascent toward the Infinite Â· Shov â€” return to action. At Sinai, Israel chose Shov ("v'shamanu v'asinu") â€” proving genuine bitul; they wanted to serve, not merely to be absorbed
Yachid â€” absolute singularity; creation does not register as a separate reality at all (Sovev's perspective) Â· Echad â€” unity encompassing multiplicity (Memale's perspective)

Yesod Abba / Chochmah Ila'ah â€” purifies through bitterness from a place of purity.
Mor Dror: in the inner sanctuary of Binah (Alma d'Cherut â€” world of freedom, where no evil can enter).
Mira Dakia: descending to refine Nogah â€” "Hinei Hashem yotzei mi'mekomo" â€” going forth to engage with tumah and taharah, kosher and treif.

Shechinah / Malchut of Atzilut becoming Atik/Keter of Beriah. Her root is in the concealment that remains hidden even during the future revelation â€” "Astir Panai ba'yom ha'hu." Even on THAT day, the inner face remains hidden. This is why Megillat Esther will never be nullified.

The soul's ascent: six months of shemen ha'mor (Gevurot d'Abba â€” purifying through Chochmah's judgment) and six months of besamim (Gevurot d'Imma â€” fragrances of Binah). Each level requires forgetting the prior pleasure. "Ashrei mi she'ba l'kan v'talmudo b'yado."
Yechidah â€” root in the Essence itself. Exclusive to Israel. Forms the Keter through bitul ratzon (Na'aseh). "Yisrael alah b'machshavah."
Chayah â€” Makif d'Chayah; Chochmah level. Haman's power reaches here (after birur). Source of holy hitnasut â€” elevated heart in divine service.
Neshamah â€” drawn from Chochmah ("Ki Atah Avinu"). Root of bitul ha'yesh / koach Mah. Mordechai's soul-level. The purifying power of the Halachot flows from here.
Ruach â€” emotional attributes / midot. The heart's fire. "Einav l'mata v'libo l'ma'alah" â€” eyes below in bitul, heart above in holy passion. The 1/64 of legitimate holy daring.
Nefesh â€” vitality connected to the body. Physical performance of mitzvot refines the Nefesh and connects it directly to Sovev â€” the highest encompassing light.

blocks.title: The Four Mashalim of Yesh & Ayin â€” Ki El De'ot
blocks.intro: Each mashal reveals the same four-level structure and two types of Ayin. "Ki El De'ot Hashem" â€” He sustains two simultaneous perspectives: De'ah Elyonah (from G-d's vantage: all is as nothing) and De'ah Tachtonah (from creation's vantage: all emerges from concealment into being).

items.content: The Deep & the Spring â€” Tehom (true Yesh) â†’ underground seep (Ayin of source) â†’ spring (Ayin of emergence) â†’ river (revealed limited Yesh). Four levels; two dimensions of nothingness.
Teacher & Student â€” Teacher's depth â†’ transmission (as nothing) â†’ bitul of receiving (student cannot transmit while absorbing) â†’ student's new Yesh. Bitul ha'yesh l'Ayin revealed.
The Planted Seed â€” Essential growth-force â†’ specific power â†’ seed's dissolution (bitul ha'yesh) â†’ new plant. The death of the old form is the precondition for new life from a higher source.

Drop & Offspring â€” Soul's essential hiyuli â†’ tipah in the brain â†’ transformation/descent â†’ child with 248 limbs. The 248 mitzvot as offspring of Chochmah at full capacity. The most physical proves the fullest source.

blocks.outro:
Two types of bitul emerge from all four mashalim:
Bitul ha'Yesh l'Ayin â€” nullifying the finite ego back toward its source (river to spring, student overwhelmed by teacher). This is Chochmah / koach Mah.
Bitul Atzmi â€” essential nullification: standing before the Essence where the question of "self" never arises. Like standing before a king â€” not an act but a state of truth. Israel's Na'aseh.

items.content:
Ga'ah #1: Levush Malchut â€” external sovereignty extended to creation (Malchut d'Ein Sof).
Ga'ah #2: Yesh HaAmiti â€” the Essence's own genuine, absolute reality. Not merely "above nothing" but essentially, truly Real.
Through these two levels of holy exaltedness (2Ã—S"AG = Sus in kedushah), the horse and rider of kelipah are cast into the sea.

Chochmah has 32 paths (×œ×‘). These extend to the heart (32 in brain + 32 in heart = 64).
A Torah scholar needs exactly 1/64 of gasut (holy daring) â€” acting as a crown, enabling the heart's aspiration to connect to the mind's bitul.
More = harmful arrogance. None = paralysis. In kelipah: Amalek's chutzpah. In kedushah: the spark of holy daring â€” "einav l'mata v'libo l'ma'alah."

blocks.text: Six Key Parables â€” Why the Highest Descends Lowest

items.title: The Great Torch
items.body: A great bonfire projects faint light to a great distance. A small candle placed there gives more local light â€” but from a lesser source. Halachot in physical matters = light from the Ma'or (Essence). Even brilliant Kabbalistic secrets are a small candle by comparison.

items.title: The Overflowing Barrel
items.body: Overflow proves the barrel is completely full. Torah Nigleh = "noblot Chochmah Stima'ah" â€” fallen leaves of Hidden Wisdom. They descend so low because the source is filled beyond measure. Overflow is a sign of superabundance, not waste.

items.title: Procreation
items.body: Physical offspring only come when the mind (mochin) reaches full maturity. The child is physical â€” seemingly "lower" than the parent's intellect â€” yet proves the fullness of power. The 248 physical mitzvot = 248 limbs of Chochmah at its fullest capacity.

items.title: The Engraved Gem
items.body: Engraved letters are invisible in a brilliant gem â€” the radiance overwhelms all contrast. Press it into wax: letters appear clearly. The Tehiru Ila'ah concealed creation's blueprints; they become visible only through external physical vessels.

items.title: Teacher & Student
items.body: The teacher's depth is the "true Yesh." What he transmits is "as nothing" compared to it. While receiving, the student is in bitul. After absorbing, he can share â€” a new, limited Yesh emerges. Two types of Ayin; four levels in every transmission.

items.title: Waves & Afterbirth
items.body: Waves rise high â€” but water flows downward; wind alone lifts them. Amalek = wind without substance. The shilya (afterbirth) protects during gestation but is discarded at birth. Amalek's "tikkun" is its own dissolution once the birurim are complete.
